verses.roman:
phiri' gela vipra ghare mane duḥkha pāñā
āra dina prabhuke kahe gaṅgāya lāga pāñā

synonyms: phiri' gela—went back; vipra—the brāhmaṇa; ghare—to his home; mane—within his mind; duḥkha—unhappiness; pāñā—getting; āra dina—the next day; prabhuke—unto the Lord; kahe—says; gaṅgāya—on the bank of the Ganges; lāga—touch; pāñā—getting.
translation: He returned home with an unhappy mind, but on the next day he met Lord Caitanya on the bank of the Ganges and spoke to Him.
